column2: Job Title:  Management Studies Lecturer Location:  Nalanda Degree College, Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh, India Job Type:  Full-Time/Part-Time About Our College: Renowned institution committed to excellence in higher education. Emphasis on innovative teaching and research in the field of management studies. Job Summary:  Nalanda Degree College is seeking a passionate and qualified Lecturer (Management Studies) to join its growing department. The selected candidate will be responsible for delivering engaging lectures, developing course curricula, and fostering a love for management studies in students. Job Description: Deliver comprehensive and engaging management studies curriculum. Foster a deep understanding of management principles and their practical applications. Prepare students for successful careers in business and management. Responsibilities:  The key responsibilities of the Lecturer (Management Studies) will include the following: Curriculum Delivery: Design and execute interactive management studies lectures and seminars on various topics, including: Business Management Marketing Human Resource Management Financial Management Organizational Behavior Strategic Management Operations Management Business Ethics Entrepreneurship International Business Lesson Planning: Develop detailed lesson plans aligned with university guidelines and industry standards. Stay updated on the latest advancements in management studies and integrate them into the curriculum. Student Assessment: Evaluate student progress through assignments, projects, and exams; maintain accurate academic records. Classroom Management: Maintain discipline and foster a collaborative and inclusive learning environment. Parental Engagement: Engage with parents/guardians as needed to discuss student progress and address concerns. Professional Development: Pursue continuous professional development and engage in collaborative research with colleagues. Contribute to the overall development of the management studies department. Qualifications:  To be considered for the position of Lecturer (Management Studies), the candidate must have the following qualifications: Founder Level: 1-3 years of experience in teaching management studies, Masters degree in Management (MBA or equivalent), and B.Ed. Master Level: 4-8 years of experience, Masters degree in Management, and B.Ed or M.Ed. Developer Level: 9+ years of experience, Masters degree in Management or related field, and M.Ed or Ph.D. Additional Qualifications: Masters degree in Management, Business Administration, or a related field (MBA, M.Com). Minimum of 3 to 5 years of teaching experience in management studies at the undergraduate level (preferred). Maximum of 10 to 15 years of relevant teaching or industry experience (desirable). Strong foundation in business management and related disciplines. Working knowledge of advanced management concepts (a plus). Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Ability to create a positive and engaging learning environment. Passion for teaching and a commitment to student success. Key Skills: Business Management:  Proficiency in teaching business management principles. Marketing and HR:  Understanding of marketing and human resource management concepts. Financial Management:  Skills in financial analysis and management. Organizational Behavior:  Knowledge of organizational behavior and development. Strategic and Operations Management:  Expertise in strategic and operations management. Communication:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Skills:  Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and engage effectively with students. Presentation Skills:  Proficiency in delivering clear and engaging lectures. Adaptability:  Willingness to learn and integrate new technologies and teaching methods. Research and Development:  Capability to contribute to academic research and departmental development. Professional Development:  Commitment to continuous professional development and growth. Screening Process: Written Test:  Subject-specific exam in management studies. Proficiency Test:  Assessment of MS Office skills. Reading Test:  Conducted via Microsoft Teams. Teaching Demonstration:  Mock classroom session. Benefits: Competitive compensation and benefits. Opportunities for professional growth and development. Supportive and collaborative work environment
